result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: WCS Non-Compliance Report dated October 21, 2022.

9:50 AM Defendant Anthony J Gagliano in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Anthony J Gagliano.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has recieved discovery.
Parties are waiting on blood test results.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on December 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
WCS Compliance Report
WCS Compliance Letter, received and filed.
Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service Non-Compliance Report dated July 11, 2022, filed by Angelique Aliota.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day.  Defendant to maintain full time employment (35 hours per week).

Court reviews WCS letter.  If defendant has another negative report Court will issue a capias and revoke bail.
Parties are waiting on the drug panel results.
Court orders bail conditions modified to include: Defendant to maintain full time employment (35 hours per week).  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
